snippet: Nearly half a century after the Soviet Union sent the first woman into space, China appears ready to send its first female astronaut aloft. But the Chinese space program, rarely one to miss a chance at some good publicity, isn't talking about its...
abstract: Nearly half a century after the Soviet Union sent the first woman into space, China appears ready to send its first female astronaut aloft. But the Chinese space program, rarely one to miss a chance at some good publicity, isn't talking about its women fliers.

headline.main: No Fanfare for China's Female Astronauts
